profession: Front-end Software Engineer & Agile Solutions Architect
introductions: Hi! I'm Dean. I'm a passionate, customer-focused and quality-first front-end software engineer with a broad range of skills. I have more than ten years experience in delivering business and customer needs in an Agile way, as well as nurturing teams to become the best delivery-focused units they can. I pride myself on enabling and guiding evolution at the team level, consistently striving for a high standard of work, being good-natured, outgoing and having a good sense of humour.
complimentarySkills: Nurturer of safe-to-fail and psychologically safe cultures.
Bridges the natural language gap between business and engineer.
Minimum viable product & time to market advisor.
me: Front-end software has always been my core passion.
I'm a data-driven thinker and I use my strong Agile analytical and organisational skills to drive technically excellent and sustainable solutions that my team and I build.
meReadMore: I attend various Agile meetups in order to keep myself up to date with how other teams tackle real-world Lean delivery issues. Although I do reference a variety of reading material, meetups are my go-to source for on-the-ground techniques and advice.
I am able to work on my own, but I have almost always found that teamwork trumps all silo-based work.

I am lively, outgoing and approachable. I love playing video games (especially RPGs), developing software on pet projects (currently learning Lua!) and cooking in my new dream kitchen, having wanted to be a chef when I was younger (before I got my hands on a PC!).
I'm a fan of electronic house music and enjoy attending music festivals.
My person-to-person and written skills are excellent and I always try to bring enthusiasm and adaptability to my work.

about: Part of the team responsible for creating and maintaining various in-store till systems including self checkout. Tasked with creating an in-house solution that severed our dependency on a third party EPOS solution.
aboutReadMore: EPOS systems are created using React, Redux, GraphQL and Node.

about: Part of the team responsible for overseeing the rollout of a two-year front-end project, as well as other client-facing applications. Also maintained the internally-shared front-end component library.
aboutReadMore: Technology primarily included TypeScript & React. Built and maintained BFFs for each of our front-end applications, maintained existing APIs and set up monitoring for server-side as well as instrumentation to monitor how our customers used our platform.
I was one of the main proponents in the adoption of behaviour-driven development. Also involved in pair programming and system design interviews.

about: Responsible for leading the team working on the main client-facing Symfony2 and AngularJS website. My role focused on the development of our front-end as well as being an Agile servant-leader for the team.
aboutReadMore: When the business changed direction away from their legacy products, I moved to a different team where I was required to plan the implementation of a completely new front-end stack, which included moving away from an old Backbone application with manual builds and no test coverage, to a React/Redux application (ES6) fully covered by Jest unit tests and automated Behaviour-driven scenarios, powered by Webpack, Yarn etc.

about: Lead the front-end software development and graphic design team. Line managed one dedicated designer and one dedicated JavaScript, CSS and HTML engineer.
aboutReadMore: Heavily involved in a two-year website and brand overhaul, built in Zend framework, jQuery and WebSocket technology. Included payment gateways, real-time user-to-user betting interfaces, social networking tools and sports news feeds.

about: Responsible for the majority of a large number of projects from beginning to end. Taking bespoke customer requirements, designing PhotoShop layouts (some including full branding), developing the PHP back-end and JS/HTML/CSS front-end, setting up hosting via IIS and Fasthosts, as well as customer support.
